newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia says to oppose labour issues at WTO.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia says to oppose labour issues at WTO.

text.p: Indonesia said on Monday it will oppose discussing investment and labour issues at the World Trade Organisation (WTO) meeting in Singapore later this year.
"There are new issues created by several industrial countries, for example investment and labour. We must careful on how we respond to it," Ariwibowo said.
"We will not agree to those issues being discussed (at the WTO) if it harms our national interest," he told reporters after meeting President Suharto.
Some nations have proposed linking trade to labour standards and have said the issue must be discussed at the WTO meeting. Other proposals include discussing a multilateral agreement on investment.
"Investment depends on rules in our country, it cannot be equal," Ariwibowo said. "Labour issues depend on the social and cultural background of our nation," he said.
